column1: Art Institute of Chicago////If you are a tourist
column2: you will find this to be an excellent place to see up close all of those classic pieces of art you've seen in books. Their history of being a fine art institution is more than represented in it's halls. As for the new Modern Wing
column4: but so far the art has lacks freshness. We are lucky to have the MCA and lots of art galleries to show us what's happening in contemporary art
column5: but I was hoping to see a little more here as well. I think it falls short to the MoMA and the Guggenheim in NYC. Â The Milwaukee Art Museum has in its collection artwork I've seen in galleries just one year ago
column6: which is really being on top of it! The St. Louis Art Museum is smaller
